abstract: A Settings presentation action stored in a view’s environment.
overview:
## Discussion

Use the `openSettings` environment value to get an [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/OpenSettingsAction] instance for a given [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment]. Then call the instance to open a window. You call the instance directly because it defines a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/OpenSettingsAction/callAsFunction()] method that Swift calls when you call the instance.

For example, you can define a button that opens the settings window to a particular tab:
